creator: sudharsanreddy@yahoo.com
text:
Recently we have upgraded Apache and Tomcat for one of our application

The web and app servers will have to be upgraded from their older versions.
Tomcat server – 5.5.16 to 7.0.23
Apache servers – 1.3.27 to 2.2.20
This also calls for a change in the Java version from v1.5.0_21-1 to v1.7.0_21.

We are seeing the following error during start up of the Apache server in httpd ssl log.

The below error we are getting in the apache log (httpd_ssl_error.2014-10-16.log)
[Thu Oct 16 15:30:29 2014] [debug] ssl_engine_io.c(1908): OpenSSL: I/O error, 11 bytes expected to read on BIO#289438 [mem: 82faf8]
[Thu Oct 16 15:30:29 2014] [debug] ssl_engine_kernel.c(1903): OpenSSL: Exit: error in SSLv2/v3 read client hello A
[Thu Oct 16 15:30:29 2014] [info] [client x.x.x.x] (70014)End of file found: SSL handshake interrupted by system [Hint: Stop button pressed in browser?!]

we are seeing continuous error and causing application to break with 200 OK error. We have to use IE 9 browser as requirement.

The proxy server received an invalid response from an upstream server

Please help at the earliest.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
There's no indication of a bug here, and you need remedial help to understand your issues.  Please use the mailing list described here:

http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users
